summary: This FBI document requests funding for an undercover operation to reimburse hotel expenses. The operation involved a meeting with an individual, an attorney representing four women suing Jeffrey Epstein, who was attempting to sell documents related to the civil case for $50,000, despite having been subpoenaed to provide them.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a civil lawsuit brought by four female individuals; the documents being sold are related to his case.

events.title: Attorney Contacted Regarding Epstein Documents
events.description: An attorney representing four women suing Jeffrey Epstein was contacted by an individual (a former Epstein employee) who had been subpoenaed for documents but was instead trying to sell them.

events.title: Undercover FBI Meeting Arranged
events.description: An undercover meeting was arranged between the individual attempting to sell documents and an FBI Undercover Employee (UCE) at a hotel.

keyFacts: A former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, who had been subpoenaed in a civil case, was attempting to sell pertinent documents for $50,000 instead of providing them as legally required.
The FBI arranged an undercover meeting on November 3, 2009, with this individual using an Undercover Employee (UCE).
The document is a funding request for $177.30 to reimburse hotel expenses incurred for this undercover operation.
The attorney involved represents four female individuals who are suing Jeffrey Epstein.
The individual's actions were characterized as illegal by the attorney, as they violated the obligations of the federal subpoena.
